text: Igor Vasilievich Gorynin (; 10 March 1926 - 9 May 2015) was a Russian metallurgist and politician. He was the creator of many new titanium and aluminium alloys, and reactor steels. He was also the inventor of the radiation hardened steels. He was the director of the Central Research Institute of Structural Materials (CRISM). Gorynin was born in Leningrad. He died after a long illness on 9 May 2015 in Saint Petersburg, aged 89. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Russian engineers Category:Russian inventors Category:Politicians from Saint Petersburg Category:Scientists from Saint Petersburg Category:Soviet politicians Category:Metallurgists
title: Igor Gorynin
